overview:
Kevin is responsible for developing products that revolutionize “sight, sound and motion” advertising through advanced targeting applications and ad decisioning technologies.

Kevin has more than 15 years of experience applying math and technical solutions to improve the efficiency of complex operations. Prior to joining Videology, he spent seven years overseeing product innovations at Advertising.com, where he developed the first large-scale exposure-based 1:1 behavioral marketing platform, the largest Palm-based mobile ad network in 2001, and other industry-leading advertising solutions.

He launched his career at Proctor & Gamble, developing new methodologies to manage the inventory and production schedules for the company’s most complex product lines to improve efficiencies.

Kevin graduated with a B.S. degree in Operations Research and Industrial Engineering in 1993, and a M.Eng. in Mechanical Engineering in 1994, both from Cornell University, College of Engineering.
